intro: Psychotria chiriquina, commonly known as the Chiriquí Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly found in the humid lowland forests of Costa Rica and Panama. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Psychotria chiriquina is often found in shaded, moist environments and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat.
